org.orgName: United States District Court, For the Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: DETECTIVE MCLACHLIN called as a witness, being first sworn, testified as follows:
114 Q. Mr McLachlin you are a detective in the City of Vancouver A. Yes
115 Q. What do you know about this case? A. Well I know this man Johnston for the last year
116 Q. That is his photograph Exhibit "A" A. Yes Exhibit "A" The first time I met him I arrested him for Vagrancy. At that time he was carrying opium

117 Q. Opium? A. No cocaine; and he threw the opium outfit out of the window. He was trying to escape from the house on Union Street. That time he got six months in his absence. He went to North Vancouver and since that time I have held him up on about four different occasions. I have ordered him out of town three times and each time he never had any money
118 Q. One of the constituents of the charge of vagrancy was that he didn't have any money? A. Yes
119 Q. He would not have been convicted if he had had any money at that time? A. No, he pleaded guilty to Vagrancy at that time.
120 Q. That was the section of Vagrancy that charges him with not having any visible means of subsistence and wandering abroad and not giving a satisfactory account of himself? A. Yes.
121 Q. How long ago was it that you last searched him for money? A. Well about a week or ten days previous to his missing.....
122 Q. A week or ten days previous to the 4th of June? A. Yes
